## Purpose

This document explains how to host an HTML file on GitHub Pages using Quarto and GitHub Desktop.

---

## Step 1: Create a Quarto document

1. Open RStudio
2. Go to File → New File → Quarto Document
3. Choose HTML as the output format
4. Save the file as `index.qmd`

---

## Step 2: Render to HTML

1. Open `index.qmd` in RStudio
2. Click Render
3. Confirm that a file named `index.html` is created

---

## Step 3: Create a GitHub repository

1. Open GitHub Desktop
2. Click File → New Repository
3. Name the repository (for example: `Test_HTML`)
4. Click Create Repository

---

## Step 4: Add files to the repository

1. Copy `index.html` into the repository folder
2. (Optional) Also include `index.qmd`

---

## Step 5: Commit and push files

1. Open GitHub Desktop
2. Write a commit message
3. Click Commit to main
4. Click Push origin

---

## Step 6: Enable GitHub Pages

1. Open the repository on GitHub.com
2. Go to Settings → Pages
3. Set:
   - Source: Deploy from a branch
   - Branch: main
   - Folder: / (root)
4. Click Save

---

## Step 7: View the website

The website will be available at:

https://YOUR-USERNAME.github.io/YOUR-REPO/


---

## Notes

GitHub Pages requires a file named `index.html` in the root of the repository.

---

## Done

Once the site loads, the URL can be submitted.
